page.title: 10Stowmarket:Local History.
page.content: The Museum of East Anglian life was established by Misses E.T.and V.M. Longe in 1965. Thirty acres of Abbots Hall Estate are used although seventy are available. It started with just two acres. There are carts, wagons, agricultural machinery, re-erected buildings,craft demonstrations, industrial and domestic displays. The oldest exhibit is a thirteenth century barn.It is continually collecting items which have to be conserved under cover.Presently thousands of exhibits are shown.Last year 34,000 people visited,of all ages. It is very cheap at one pound twenty pence for adults ,60p for children,and 70p for OAPs. People generally browse although there are quide books available. It is busiest in July and August when family groups or coachtrips visit. There are future expansion plans.
